resources.string: Test yourself with your own custom cipher!
Please choose a type of cipher

The Caesar cipher is credited as the first shift cipher. It is named after Roman emperor Julius Caesar, who used the cipher for his private messages. The Caesar cipher works by shifting a given character three spaces to the right. For example, the letter B would become the letter E.
Encrypt the plain text, emperor, using the Caesar Cipher
This is the same as the Caesar cipher but here the encryption and the decryption uses the same architecture. This is due to the shift being half the length of the alphabet, 13.
Encrypt the plain text, thirteen, using the ROT13 Cipher

This is a polyalphabetic cipher, it is made up of many interwoven Caesar ciphers based on some key word. For example if we have the plain text and key, bob and ana respectively. We would shift b by 0 as a is the first letter in the alphabet, then o by 13 and b by 0. This gives us bab as the cipher text.
Encrypt the plain text, blaise, using the vigenère Cipher and the key: key
